alert.note: Alert for Emmons (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN BURLEIGH AND NORTHWESTERN EMMONS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles northwest of Hazelton, or 22 miles northwest of Linton, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 40 mph and penny size hail possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Burleigh and northwestern Emmons Counties, including the following locations... Moffit and Hazelton Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
